messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Akasaka Age
messages.msgSnippet: Cheers Jim, I ll try and get some snaps of the Mimi and let you see that, it si a nice piece but I am sticking with my 6th -7th gen era I think. Seems more
messages.messageBody:
Cheers Jim, I'll try and get some snaps of the Mimi and let you see that, it si a nice piece but I am sticking with my 6th -7th gen era
I think. Seems more likely to me.

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Jim Gilbert
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, November 09, 2003 7:51 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Akasaka Age


Rich,
A lot are even thicker. Early Akasaka guards will usually have a very full, round maru mimi. Owari guards tend to be rather squarish (but there are exceptions). Some guards that otherwise resemble Owari get put into Ko-Shoami if the rim is more rounded. But these have no where near the rounding of early Akasaka work.

I'll get to something on Ezo and Ainu work in the next couple of days.

The lunar eclipse is underway here in the Eastern US.

Jim



Hi Jim, yes that's them, that's what I thought as well, I thought they were mostly pretty chunky like the Owari guards.

Rich

p.s. strange about these links of mine, I must have been studying at the "Milt school of URL linking" :-)

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

----- Original Message -----
From: Jim Gilbert
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, November 09, 2003 4:41 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Akasaka Age


Richard,
For some reason I can't use your links - I get an error message saying the file is inaccessible. (Same thing that happened before.)

Is this the tsuba labeled Akasaka-1 & 2 in your folder ("Sashimono in negative silhouette and clouds in positive silhouette")?

4 mm would be unusually thin for early Akasaka. The late guards can be that thin.
Jim



Hi all, I picked this Akasaka tsuba up some time ago. It was sold to me as Shôami I think from memory. I personally believed it to be from around the 6th or 7th Gen Akasaka line, though unsure who in that line may have made it.

A few months back I took it to a trip to Melbourne and showed it to some friends and our local Kodôgu expert there believed it was early Akasaka, maybe around the time of the 2 - 4th gen.

It is Wak sized and about 4mm thick. Any thought's ?

Front http://tinyurl.com/u5zr Back http://tinyurl.com/u5zk

cheers all

Rich
